arts.ttl: 'Amazing': Nuno Espirito Santo names the two Forest players who really impressed him vs Palace last night
I saw Nottingham Forest star show exactly why Nuno didn't drop him after mistake last month
¬£4m star Nottingham Forest wanted in the summer spotted at the City Ground
Wood joins elite list with Haaland and Palmer
arts.sum: "We found out that my wife is pregnant a couple of days ago so that's the announcement to the world," Wood said after Forest's first home league win of the season. Wood's 65th-minute strike means that only Manchester City's Erling Haaland (23) and Cole Palmer of Chelsea (22) have more Premier League goals than the 16 he has scored since Nuno Espirito Santo took charge at the City Ground just before last Christmas.

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner makes admission over Crystal Palace‚Äôs winless Premier League start
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner says Crystal Palace‚Äôs winless start to the 2024-25 Premier League is down to a lack of confidence. The Eagles lost 1-0 at Nottingham Forest on Monday evening to extend their run to eight Premier League gams without three points ‚Äì surpassing the record of seven without a win at the start of the 2017-18 season under Frank de Boer and Roy Hodgson.

arts.ttl: 'Time for hugging, not kicking' - is it as bad as it seems for Palace?
arts.sum: Crystal Palace have suffered their worst start to a Premier League season since 1992-93 - but is it as bad as it seems?

arts.ttl: Nuno Espirito Santo happy after Nottingham Forest claim first home win of season
arts.sum: Dean Henderson‚Äôs mistake from Chris Wood‚Äôs first-time strike gave Forest a first home league victory of the season.

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner: ‚ÄòPalace keeper Dean Henderson tried to apologise for error in Nottingham Forest defeat‚Äô
arts.sum: Palace went close to taking the lead in the first half when Eddie Nketiah took aim from distance in the 19th minute, but his effort crashed off the outside of the right-hand corner of the goal. Forest eventually took the lead in the 65th minute when Trevoh Chalobah‚Äôs clearance fell to Chris Wood, who unleashed a half-volley past Dean Henderson.

arts.ttl: Loss very frustrating and disappointing - Glasner
arts.sum: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner says his side's 1-0 loss at Nottingham Forest is "very frustrating and very disappointing".

arts.ttl: Wood strikes again to give Nottingham Forest 1-0 win over Crystal Palace
arts.sum: ‚ÄúWe needed a home win and thankfully we got it,‚Äù Wood said. The goal capped a busy performance by Wood but Forest also owed a debt to keeper Matz Sels who made two excellent saves, first from a Eberechi Eze free kick after an hour and then from Jeffrey Schlupp with nine minutes remaining.
